actions.action: Work out how to integrate inline XSP docs (such as inline esql docs) into the build docs procedure. This will fix a dead link which leads on to the next item...

Write a full guide to logicsheets, including: (1) What they are and how they work - explaining why XSP results can't be assigned to XSLT variables; (2) What all the supplied logicsheets do (long-term aim: document every tag and every attribute); (3) How to write your own and use it; (4) How to specify logicsheet execution order with the as-yet-undocumented <?xml-logicsheet?> processing instruction. Partial contributions welcome! :-)

Workaround redirect problem with Tomcat and IE and Cocoon (code written; just needs to be merged in.) I marked this high-priority because the only known workarounds are stop using Tomcat 3.1 or stop using IE(!) - both of which are unacceptable.
Fix remaining caching bugs. Cleanup caching code, which is messy.
More meaningful XSLT and filenotfound error reporting for XSP logicsheets (currently just throws a NullPointerException)
Class auto-reloading for XSP pages (code written; just needs to be merged in and documented.)
Ensure that all HTML docs are not too wide for screen/printer width (as appropriate - there are separate directories for screen and printer docs).
FAQ (particularly) and XSP docs are too long lengthwise. Split them up. Their length (or complexity) causes extremely slow rendering on Netscape 4.x and recent Mozilla builds.
Make <connect> tags work correctly when xdocs are transformed to HTML docs.
Make authors appear on all HTML docs (where appropriate).
Fix Jikes compilation error reporting bug.

Make cache more configurable (e.g. to turn off per-user-agent caching, maybe for specific pages only). However, Mark Washeim thinks that this offers only "trivial" overhead reduction, even on large sites.
Better error reporting for typos in stylesheet URIs.
Automated test suite - maybe build upon samples and JMeter??
Work out best way of breaking the 64K method barrier in XSP. (The ESQL logicsheet already tries to address this by executing queries in separate methods.)
